author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: Attack of the Ukrainian Armed Forces on the port of Kavkaz: what is known, how many were injured, comments from the authorities
text:
The Ukrainian Armed Forces hit the Kavkaz port with a Neptune missile and sank a ferry
The Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) attacked one of the largest passenger ports in Russia, Kavkaz in Krasnodar Krai. This was reported by the operational headquarters of Kuban.
According to the department, the Ukrainian army used a Neptune missile. The strike hit a railway ferry with fuel tanks. According to some reports, a moored vessel was hit.
“The Kiev regime has committed another attempt at a terrorist attack in the Krasnodar region – a railway ferry with fuel tanks was attacked in the port of Kavkaz. Emergency and special services are working at the scene. The area of ​​the fire and information about the victims are being clarified,” said representatives of the operational headquarters.
Emergency services have arrived at the scene. The area of ​​the fire is being determined.
Frame: Telegram channel “Crimean Wind”
Russian ferry sunk after missile attack A railway ferry damaged as a result of a missile attack by the Ukrainian Armed Forces sank, the Krasnodar Territory operational headquarters reported. “As a result of the damage received, the ferry sank in the waters of the port of Kavkaz,” the report said.
According to preliminary information, there were 15 people on the attacked ferry “Conro Trader” with fuel tanks.
Later, Krasnodar Region Governor Veniamin Kondratyev reported that 17 crew members of the ferry in the port had been rescued. “They are looking for two more people,” he wrote.
Frame: Telegram channel “Crimean Wind”
The operational headquarters also noted that there are no fires in the port itself. However, it is known that there were dozens of fuel tanks in the port at the time of the attack. According to the head of the Temryuk district, Fyodor Babenkov, 12 fire brigades are working at the site.
“There are 12 fire brigades, three ambulance teams, rescuers from the Temryuk District ASS, and rescuers from Kuban SPAS working at the site. There were 30 fuel tanks on the ferry,” the official said.
Information about the victims, as well as the number of crew members on the ferry, is currently being clarified. “The situation in the seaport “Kavkaz” is under the control of emergency and security services,” the Russian Ministry of Transport reported. Port employees were evacuated outside its perimeter, and a rescue vessel is heading to the scene of the incident.
Related materials:
The moment of the explosion at the port was caught on video Footage posted online shows a thick black column of smoke rising from the port area. Then an explosion is heard, followed by a bright flash. Eyewitnesses report that the smoke is visible on the Taman Peninsula.
The fire on the ferry was assigned a complexity rating of No. 3. The Kuban operational headquarters also reminded local residents about the ban on publications, photos, videos and dissemination of information on social networks related to the operation of air defense systems.
#Attack #Ukrainian #Armed #Forces #port #Kavkaz #injured #comments #authorities

author: Nate Ostiller
title: White House defends Zelensky's ammunition plant visit, calls Republican investigation 'political stunt'
text: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre pushed back on calls from top Republicans to investigate President Volodymyr Zelensky's recent visit to a Pennsylvania ammunition plant, telling reporters on Sept. 26 that it was a "political stunt" and that they "need to drop this." Zelensky visited the [Scranton Army Ammunition Plant](https://kyivindependent.com/zelensky-visits-pennsylvania-ammunition-plant-to-thank-workers/) on Sept. 22, along with Democratic Governor Josh Shapiro and other Democratic politicians from the state, to thank workers for producing critically needed 155 mm shells for Ukraine. Following the visit, Republican Congressman James Comer, who chairs the House Oversight Committee, [announced](https://kyivindependent.com/house-speaker-calls-on-zelensky-to-fire-ambassador-to-us-fox-news-reports/) on Sept. 25 that he was opening up an investigation into the White House's "misuse of government resources." Later in the day, House Speaker Mike Johnson, also a Republican, wrote a letter to Zelensky demanding that Ukraine's ambassador to the U.S., Oksana Markarova, be fired for alleged "election interference." Johnson argued that Markarova had arranged a taxpayer-funded trip to a battleground state that "purposely excluded" Republicans ahead of the U.S. presidential election. Jean-Pierre dismissed the investigation into the visit as a [partisan effort from Republicans](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uDlacAJH_a0&ab_channel=TheWhiteHouse). She said the Ukrainian delegation had asked to visit the plant, and the Department of Defense (DoD) arranged for their transportation, "which is common." The press secretary added that [Zelensky had visited Utah's Republican Governor Spencer Cox in July](https://kyivindependent.com/zelensky-to-address-us-governors-in-salt-lake-city/) to address the National Governors Association and that "there was not a single demand for an investigation" after the trip from Republicans. Zelensky's visit to the ammunition plant was "business as usual for a Ukrainian request during wartime," Jean-Pierre said.

author: JACKSON WALKER | The National Desk
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Sunday will be a lot calmer than Saturday with some nice sunbreaks for the morning and most of the afternoon. Showers will start moving back after sunset. Highs today will hit the mid to upper 50s.{/p}{p}Showers will take over tonight making for a wet start to your Monday morning. Lows should drop to the upper 40s in most spots.{/p}{p}Monday will have frequent showers and the chance of a thundershower or two. The best chance to hear the rumble of thunder will be along the ocean beaches, areas south of Tacoma, and in the Puget Sound Convergence Zone of north King and south Snohomish Counties. Highs on Monday will make it to the mid to upper 50s once again.{/p}{p}Rain will continue on Tuesday under gray skies. Highs should drop back to a bit to the mid-50s.{/p}{p}Right now the forecast models say Wednesday should bring mostly dry weather with some sunbreaks. It will not be all that warm with daytime highs only getting to the low to mid-50s.{/p}{p}Theron Zahn{br}The KOMO 4-Cast Team{br}{/p}{p}{strong}Updated Sunday Morning{/strong}{/p}{p}Mia Schem, a 21-year-old Israeli-French tattoo artist, is likening her time in Hamas captivity to the Holocaust.{br}{/p}{p}In October, Schem was featured in a Hamas video receiving medical attention for a wound on her arm while laying in a bed. She then speaks to the camera as a loud boom is heard in the background.{/p}{p}“They are taking care of me, giving me medicine, everything is fine,” Schem {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/hamas-terrorists-release-video-of-abducted-french-woman-get-us-out-of-here-as-quickly-as-possible-palestine-israel-war-fighting-middle-east-hostage-\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/hamas-terrorists-release-video-of-abducted-french-woman-get-us-out-of-here-as-quickly-as-possible-palestine-israel-war-fighting-middle-east-hostage-\"}said {/a}in Hebrew. “I only ask that they bring me home as soon as possible to my parents, to my siblings. Please get us out of here as quickly as possible.”{/p}{p}Schem was recently released as part of a temporary ceasefire between Israel and Hamas. In a new {a href=\"https://twitter.com/IMTIzionism/status/1740424632606589343\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://twitter.com/IMTIzionism/status/1740424632606589343\"}interview{/a}, she speaks candidly about the maltreatment of individuals captured by Hamas.{/p}{p}“It was important to me to reflect the real situation on the people who live in Gaza,” Schem said in a preview clip released by Israel's Channel 12 News Thursday.{/p}{p}{strong}READ MORE |{ }{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/lady-in-red-photographed-fleeing-oct-7-hamas-attacks-feels-guilty-over-survival-report-says-vlada-patapov-israel-nova-music-festival-terrorists-terrorism-gaza-palestine-middle-east-conflict#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/lady-in-red-photographed-fleeing-oct-7-hamas-attacks-feels-guilty-over-survival-report-says-vlada-patapov-israel-nova-music-festival-terrorists-terrorism-gaza-palestine-middle-east-conflict#\"}'Lady in red' photographed fleeing Oct. 7 Hamas attacks feels guilty over survival, report says{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}When asked what the “important thing” she wants people to understand is, Schem said her treatment by Hamas was historically evil.{/p}{blockquote}“I went through the Holocaust,” she said. “Everyone there is a terrorist.\"{/blockquote}{p}She went on to describe the conditions in the Hamas camps as scary and strict.{/p}{p}“I was closed in the room, it's dark. Talking is forbidden. You must not be seen, heard. They are hiding you. There is a terrorist watching you 24/7, looking at you, raping you with his eyes,” she said.{/p}{p}The captivity made Schem fear for her life, she said.{/p}{p}{strong}READ MORE |{ }{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/viral-post-sparks-outrage-for-suggesting-hamas-terrorists-treated-hostage-unexpectedly-well-maree-campbell-the-curated-edit-israel-maya-regev-hostages-palestine-gaza-strip-twitter-x-elon-musk#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/viral-post-sparks-outrage-for-suggesting-hamas-terrorists-treated-hostage-unexpectedly-well-maree-campbell-the-curated-edit-israel-maya-regev-hostages-palestine-gaza-strip-twitter-x-elon-musk#\"}Viral post sparks outrage for suggesting Hamas terrorists treated hostage 'unexpectedly well'{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}“Sure, there’s fear of getting raped. There is fear of dying. There is a fear, you are scared,\" she explained. \"I was at his house of his family. His wife was outside the room with the children. That was the only reason he did not rape me.”{/p}{p}Social media influencer Sulaiman Ahmed incorrectly claimed in October that Schem was a hostage of Israel, not Hamas. The same user wrongly stated Israel had destroyed a Greek Orthodox church in Gaza, despite the church’s own claims to the contrary. author: Eleon Lass
title: Le GOP intensifie l’enquête de destitution avec une expédition de pêche pour Hunter Biden Docs
text:
As House Republicans aggressively seek a justification to impeach President
Joe Biden, Rep. James Comer (R-KY) said his Oversight Committee is now probing whether the White House knew anything about Hunter Biden’s decision to flaunt a closed-door deposition requested by the panel.
Both the House Oversight and Judiciary Committees on Wednesday demanded the White House turn over any recent communication between
Hunter Biden and White House employees, as well as any internal communications surrounding Biden’s Dec. 6 claim that he never interacted with Hunter’s business partners.
Hunter Biden, the president’s son,
defied a congressional subpoena earlier this month—offering to testify in a public hearing but not a closed-door session.
White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre later that day said Biden was “certainly familiar with what his son was going to say.”
That line alone sent Comer on another fishing expedition to examine “whether the President corruptly sought to influence or obstruct the Committees’ proceeding by preventing, discouraging, or dissuading his son from complying with the Committees’ subpoenas,” according to a letter penned by Comer and Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH).
“Such conduct could constitute an impeachable offense,” they added.
A years-long GOP investigation has
struggled to produce evidence linking Biden to any illegal activity. That didn’t stop House Republicans from going all-in, voting to open a formal impeachment inquiry earlier this month.
The committee gave the White House a two-week deadline to produce the documents it requested.

author: Kelly Fisher
title: Loretta Lynn's Granddaughter Emmy Russell Is Pregnant With Baby No. 1 | 102.1 The Bull
text:
Emmy Russell is pregnant with Baby No. 1!
Russell, 25, revealed in a recent episode of the Got It From My Momma podcast that she’s expecting a baby with her partner, fellow singer-songwriter Tyler Ward , 40. The American Idol finalist and her mother, Patsy Russell , appeared together on an episode of the podcast earlier this month. It was previously recorded live on Music Row in Nashville, Tennessee.
Host Jennifer Vickery Smith launched the podcast to feature conversations with mothers of entertainers, including about their childhoods and family lives. Vickery Smith said at the top of the episode that “Emmy Rose has some special news to share tonight.”
“Y’all, me and Tyler are expecting a baby girl,” Emmy announced. Ward briefly joined her on stage and cradled his hands over Emmy's growing baby bump “I’m so excited. Right out of American Idol , I didn’t know. So, you know, that’s kind of been the journey. So I’m so excited. I’m so looking forward to it. …This is the first time I’m actually fully announcing that. I thought it was fitting for this.”
Throughout the conversation, Emmy and Patsy spoke about their lives with their grandmother and mother, respectively, Loretta Lynn . The beloved country trailblazer “passed away peacefully…in her sleep” the morning of October 4, 2022 at her ranch in Hurricane Mills, Tennessee. She was 90. Emmy previously shared how Lynn empowered her to write her own music . She also honored her late grandmother with emotional tributes during her run on American Idol earlier this year.
Find Got It From My Momma on iHeartRadio here .

author: Daily Excelsior
title: Amnesty scheme big relief to dealers: CCI
text:
‘100 % hike at Nashri Toll Plaza most unfair ‘
Excelsior Correspondent
JAMMU, Dec 28: The Jammu Chamber of Industries and Commerce president, Arun Gupta has said that a big relief has been accorded to the dealers with the amnesty scheme.
The Chamber president expressed his deep gratitude to the Manoj Sinha, LG UT of J&K, Rajeev Rai Bhatnagar, Advisor to LG, Atal Dulloo, Chief Secretary UT of J&K for accepting our long pending demand regarding granting amnesty for settlement of tax arrears pertaining to Pre GST regime for the dealers who could not take the benefit of earlier amnesty scheme issued vide order no. 39-F-D of 2018 due to various reasons especially Covid-19 pandemic.
Gupta said that this amnesty scheme will provide relief to the dealers on 100% waiver of penalty and interest under general sales tax act 1962, Central Sales Tax 1956 and VAT Act 2005. He further said that this decision of the Government will result in minimizing the tax dispute cases.
Arun Gupta requests the business community to avail tax benefit of this amnesty scheme by depositing the tax arrears within the prescribed time limit.
He further said that during the initial stage of implementing the GST scheme there were some technical / other minor mistakes on the part of the dealers/ assesses due to unawareness about GST scheme. Chamber requests the government that those dealers / assesses should be given one time opportunity to settle their cases especially for the period 2017-2018, 2018-2019 and 2019-2020.
Gupta also requests the Government/NHAI to reconsider the decision of enhancing the toll tax by 100% at Nashri Toll Plaza as it will effect the business community/general public badly.
Amnesty scheme big relief to dealers: CCI
‘100 % hike at Nashri Toll Plaza most unfair ‘

author: Kishor Panthi
title: Tragic Accident Claims Lives of Two Nepali Students in Louisiana; GoFundMe Launched for Final Rites - NewsBreak
text: Two Nepali international students, 22-year-old Rajan Yadav from Siraha and 20-year-old Rojin Oli from Dang, lost their lives in a car accident on U.S. Highway 80 in Louisiana on Sunday, July 13, 2025. Both students, enrolled at Louisiana Tech University, were traveling in a car driven by Yadav when it veered off the road and crashed into a tree during heavy rainfall around 9 p.m. The collision caused the vehicle to catch fire, leading to the tragic deaths of the two students. Two other students in the car sustained serious injuries and were rushed to a nearby hospital for treatment. To support the families of Rajan and Rojin, a GoFundMe campaign has been initiated by Rajan’s relative, Patiram Yadav. The funds will cover funeral costs, repatriation of remains if needed, and related ceremonial expenses. The campaign, aiming to raise $50,000, had collected $42,646 at the time of this report. The fundraiser emphasizes that every contribution, no matter how small, will help the grieving families navigate this difficult time. The organizer has expressed gratitude for the community’s support and urged people to contribute to the cause. Those wishing to donate can visit the GoFundMe page. Louisiana Tech University issued a statement expressing profound sorrow over the loss of the two international students, noting that the tragedy has deeply affected the entire university community. The university extended its condolences to the families and loved ones of Rajan and Rojin, acknowledging the weight of this devastating event. To support students during this time, Louisiana Tech has made counseling services available and is planning a memorial event through its Office of International Affairs to honor the memory of the deceased. The post Tragic Accident Claims Lives of Two Nepali Students in Louisiana; GoFundMe Launched for Final Rites appeared first on NEPYORK .
